examples: Alternatively the point the universe is pretty freakin’ weird.
Alternatively, we could combine the water with more carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.
Alternatively, we could define a function where every numerical input corresponds to a different alphabetical output.
Alternatively, it could just be a random mutation.
Alternatively, you can search for them in the search bar.
words.defineEn: as a second choice or another possibility
words.defineVi: như một sự lựa chọn thứ hai hoặc khả năng khác

examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Are you up to the challenge?
They faced many challenges, but eventually made it to the other side.
It can be challenging to abstract complex concepts into simple explanations.
It can be challenging for someone from a different socioeconomic background to fit into an affluent community.
words.defineEn: a difficult and new task that puts one's skill, ability, and determination to the test
words.defineVi: một nhiệm vụ khó khăn và mới đặt kỹ năng, khả năng và quyết tâm của một người để kiểm tra

examples: The entrepreneur received a lot of feedback from friends and family on her new business idea.
The CEO of the company listened to the feedback of all employees, regardless of their rank or expertise.
The survey aimed to gather feedback from both adults and children.
The woman trusted her friend to give her honest feedback on her work, knowing that a friend's eye is a good mirror, and valued her insights in improving her performance.
If the proposal is rejected, we'll need to lick our wounds, gather feedback, and make improvements before submitting again.
words.defineEn: information, criticism, or advice about a person's performance, a new product, etc. intended for improvement
words.defineVi: thông tin, lời chỉ trích hoặc lời khuyên về hiệu suất của một người, một sản phẩm mới, v.v. nhằm mục đích cải thiện

examples: He is consulting his zodiacal chart to determine his compatibility with different signs.
The agent put me on hold while she consulted a colleague.
I asked Alex to consult on this project because it's a bit out of my depth.
The CEO of the company was known for making hasty decisions without consulting his team.
As a newly married couple, we have learned that he that will thrive must first ask his wife, and we always make sure to consult each other before making any important decisions.
words.defineEn: to seek information or advice from someone with knowledge in a particular field
words.defineVi: để tìm kiếm thông tin hoặc lời khuyên từ một người có kiến thức trong một lĩnh vực cụ thể

examples: A new law is proposed to curb this type of blatantly dishonest description, and not before time
Because of the proposed merger, the company is standing at the crossroads.
He also casts his eye over the proposed law changes.
The government decided to abandon the proposed legislation due to public opposition.
We should take the lead in proposing a compromise and be ready to give ground on several points.
words.defineEn: to put forward a suggestion, plan, or idea for consideration
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một gợi ý, kế hoạch, hoặc ý tưởng để xem xét

examples: Not everyone likes the connotation.
At one time in African-American culture, the name also had a very negative connotation.
When people hear the word developer, it has a certain connotation that might not necessarily be all that positive.
Frankincense and myrrh are perhaps best known for their biblical connotations.
They were much more likely to think the word’s connotation was its most disgusting trait.
words.defineEn: a feeling or an idea suggested by a word aside from its literal or primary meaning
words.defineVi: một cảm giác hoặc một ý tưởng được gợi ý bởi một từ ngoài nghĩa đen hoặc nghĩa chính của nó

examples: The guidance system keeps the machine on course.
The parent can offer guidance and support, but if the child doesn't want to change, he won't improve.
They would bow down in prayer every morning, seeking guidance and strength.
For the arduous trek before them, she knew they required the sturdy guidance of one who had walked many paths.
They'll make mistakes at first, but with patience and guidance they'll only improve.
words.defineEn: help and advice about how to solve a problem, given by someone who is knowledgeable and experienced
words.defineVi: giúp đỡ và lời khuyên về cách giải quyết vấn đề, được đưa ra bởi một người có kiến thức và kinh nghiệm

examples: We have included some hints for beginners in this section.
They added a pinch of maple sugar to their morning coffee for a hint of natural sweetness.
Almond-leaved pear has a mild sweetness and a hint of almond taste.
I tried a new coffee blend with hints of chocolate and caramel.
The carob-covered almonds provided a delightful crunch and a hint of sweetness in every bite.
words.defineEn: a slight suggestion or piece of advice that shows how a problem is solved
words.defineVi: một gợi ý nhỏ hoặc một lời khuyên cho thấy một vấn đề được giải quyết như thế nào

examples: Obviously, implicitly this carbon had another hydrogen that we are not showing.
If you don't draw them, they are implicitly there.
And then in a ring like this, this would implicitly be the number one carbon.
JOHN PAUL STEVENS: I trusted him implicitly, have the highest regard for him as a lawyer.
They both have other hydrogens off there that we didn't draw, they're implicitly there.
words.defineEn: in a way that is suggested without being directly or clearly expressed
words.defineVi: theo cách được gợi ý mà không được thể hiện trực tiếp hoặc rõ ràng

examples: When the company lost a major client, it prompted the CEO to reassess the company's strategy and make changes that helped them gain new clients - as they say, a stumble may prevent a fall.
The controversial political scandal that dominated news cycles for a week turned into a seven-day wonder, capturing public attention and prompting investigations and debates.
The incident prompted an SEC investigation into Kodak's disclosure of the loan.
Branson's request for a bailout prompted mockery from some corners, especially in the British press.
A decline in new infections has prompted a wider loosening of restrictions.
words.defineEn: to encourage someone to do or say something
words.defineVi: để khuyến khích ai đó làm hoặc nói điều gì đó

examples: Dietary experts can advise on the ins and outs of dieting.
My doctor advised me to drink pasteurized milk during my pregnancy for the safety of my baby.
An old hand advised me that the fireman approach would suit my scrawny physique.
The doctor advised wearing protective clothing to minimize exposure to harmful radiation during the X-ray procedure.
They advised them to invest in better security measures.
words.defineEn: to provide someone with a suggestion regarding a specific situation
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó một gợi ý liên quan đến một tình huống cụ thể

examples: The report includes a number of recommendations.
She asked friends and family for recommendations on where to find affordable caviar.
We get most of our work through word-of-mouth recommendations.
When a student goes AWOL repeatedly, the Principal determines the appropriate disciplinary action, up to and including recommendation for discharge.
The neighborhood bookstore, despite the rise of online retailers, is alive and kicking, offering personalized recommendations and hosting book signings that draw in book lovers from the community.
words.defineEn: a suggestion or piece of advice given to someone officially, especially about the course of action that they should take
words.defineVi: một gợi ý hoặc một lời khuyên được đưa ra cho ai đó một cách chính thức, đặc biệt là về quá trình hành động mà họ nên thực hiện

examples: The security expert warned the business owner that a bad padlock invites a picklock.
The teacher's stern grimace warned the students to behave.
Parents often warn their children that evil communications corrupt good manners, urging them to surround themselves with positive influences.
He warned us that we would pay the price.
The detective warned the gang members that blood will have blood, and that their violent actions would only lead to more violence and retribution.
words.defineEn: to tell someone about a possible danger or problem in order to prevent harm or damage
words.defineVi: để nói với ai đó về một mối nguy hiểm hoặc vấn đề có thể xảy ra để ngăn chặn tác hại hoặc thiệt hại

examples: He admonished his alchemical colleagues not to trust the words of the ancient masters.
A lot of other English words are derived from monere, like premonition, admonish, demonstrate and monitor.
Reade claimed that she was admonished for how she dressed by a supervisor, and that that was part of the retaliation.
words.defineEn: to strongly urge or advice a person to take a particular action
words.defineVi: thúc giục mạnh mẽ hoặc khuyên một người thực hiện một hành động cụ thể

examples: So, at the top line, I really commend that goal.
President Bush commended hiscourage and leaders the world overhailed him.
And I commend them for doing so.
And I commend him really for investing in American higher education.
And I really commend those young kids at Stoneman Douglas, where they actually stepped up after the incident that happened there.
words.defineEn: to mention someone or something with approval and put them forward as suitable
words.defineVi: đề cập đến ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó với sự chấp thuận và đưa họ về phía trước là phù hợp

examples: She always keeps her own counsel at times like these.
The agent counsels them obliquely against waste, repeats the letter of the law, and smiles.
The driver knew that anger and haste hinder good counsel when he was cut off in traffic.
Up until now, I have kept my own counsel about my reasons for leaving the Department of Justice.
He knew that a fool may give a wise man counsel, and that good ideas could come from unexpected sources.
words.defineEn: to advise someone to take a course of action
words.defineVi: để khuyên ai đó thực hiện một quá trình hành động

words.defineEn: not sensible and likely to have unwanted consequences
words.defineVi: không hợp lý và có khả năng có hậu quả không mong muốn

examples: It's been sort of tacitly allowed by the league and in many cases encouraged by the teams.
words.defineEn: understood or implied without expressing directly
words.defineVi: hiểu hoặc ngụ ý mà không diễn đạt trực tiếp

examples: Auto Zone's competitors are liable to not give up commercial auto parts retail market share without a fight either.
Right now, e-commerce companies aren't usually liable for counterfeits sold by a third party on their platforms.
The factory is liable to waste a lot less time, energy and materials if it discovers a defect in something.
But college was presented as the only liable real option.
As a general matter, a gun maker is not going to be liable if a criminal misuses their firearms.
words.defineEn: likely to be subject to a problem, disease, etc.
words.defineVi: có khả năng là đối tượng của một vấn đề, bệnh tật, vv

words.defineEn: feeling that something must be done because it is morally proper or mandatory
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rằng một cái gì đó phải được thực hiện bởi vì nó là đúng về mặt đạo đức hoặc bắt buộc

examples: The president is exempt from it.
So in a concession to unions, the War Labor Board exempted employer-paid health benefits from wage controls and income tax.
But it exempted fantasy sports as long as they involved more skill than chance.
Spoiler warning: No, we humans are not exempt.
And states also will have less flexibility to exempt able-bodied adults without children or dependents from those requirements.
words.defineEn: free from a requirement or liability that is imposed on other people
words.defineVi: miễn phí từ một yêu cầu hoặc trách nhiệm pháp lý được áp đặt cho người khác

examples: I'll undo the binding.
The binding of Osiris and his revival is a promise to Egyptians of eternal life.
Anyhow, the binding of the viral RNA to these DNA probes creates a change in the electrical charge of the molecules.
A spiral binding, we got the shipping costs down.
This medicine blocks the binding of aldosterone, a hormone secreted by the adrenal glands right above your kidneys.
words.defineEn: legally impossible to avoid and must be obeyed
words.defineVi: về mặt pháp lý không thể tránh và phải được tuân theo

examples: The steel-toe boots are mandatory for workers in construction sites to ensure safety.
This is a mandatory evacuation event.
His life here includes mandatory Mandarin classes in the evenings.
Mask-wearing was mandatory.
In Germany, health insurance is mandatory for all citizens and permanent residents.
words.defineEn: ordered or required by a rule or law
words.defineVi: ra lệnh hoặc yêu cầu bởi một quy tắc hoặc pháp luật

examples: Prioritize your emergency fund over optional purchases.
Can the photos be clothing optional?
Paying your phone bill or mechanic isn’t optional.
But with virtually unlimited optional extras, upgrades, and customizations, the true cost of a bespoke Rolls-Royce has no limits.
Almost as if art isn't optional for humans.
words.defineEn: available to be chosen but not enforced
words.defineVi: có sẵn để được chọn nhưng không được thi hành

examples: Oxygen is compulsory.
Australia has compulsory voting.
Compulsory sterilization was challenged in the US Supreme Court in 1927 in the famous Buck v. Bell case.
Some types of works like musical compositions and sound recordings, for example, are subject to compulsory or statutory licenses for certain uses.
With the spread of compulsory education, schools became the one place where health officials had a truly captive audience.
words.defineEn: forced to be done by law or authority
words.defineVi: buộc phải được thực hiện bởi pháp luật hoặc cơ quan có thẩm quyền

examples: Too many companies reckon without the pitfalls that make insurance like this an absolute necessity.
But they had reckoned without Sister Murphy.
He reckons his new mobile phone is the best thing since sliced bread.
We presume she reckons without her host.
He thought he'd get away with his crime, but he reckoned without the FBI agents.
words.defineEn: to think or have an opinion about something
words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ hoặc có một ý kiến về một cái gì đó

examples: The CEO of the company listened to the feedback of all employees, regardless of their rank or expertise.
The coach believed that nature passes nurture, and that some athletes are just naturally more talented than others, regardless of their training and practice.
The teacher went on about the topic he had chosen regardless of the fact that many students were asleep.
I think she has rats in the attic because she declined to accept that work regardless of the salary and benefits.
Regardless of where the bacteria came from, the test results should sound an alarm bell.
words.defineEn: with no attention to the thing mentioned
words.defineVi: không chú ý đến điều được đề cập

examples: So an opinionated narcissist likes this place?
John, the fans of Game of Thrones are very opinionated.
Alexievich valued memories- sad, opinionated, defiant or nostalgic- as markers of what was historically important.
People with paranoid personality can be very argumentative, but that could just be seen as opinionated and outspoken.
words.defineEn: having strong opinions and not willing to change them
words.defineVi: có ý kiến mạnh mẽ và không sẵn sàng thay đổi chúng

examples: Finally, and most convincingly, were bits of magnetite, a magnetic mineral produced by some lifeforms, trapped within the carbonite.
I've recently been getting some emails that look convincingly like messages from YouTube, asking me to confirm my account.

And it's been shown to be not only effective against microbes, but also it's been shown, I think fairly convincingly, to be safe to even have people potentially in that environment where that light is being used.
words.defineEn: in a way that makes people believe something is true
words.defineVi: trong một cách mà làm cho mọi người tin rằng một cái gì đó là sự thật

examples: American conservatism is precisely the reverse.
Another result of conservatism was a new rationale for allegiance to a kingdom or state.
The range of conservatism is far bigger.
What's happened to conservatism?
That, to me, is what conservatism is.
words.defineEn: a political belief with an inclination to keep the traditional values in a society by avoiding changes
words.defineVi: một niềm tin chính trị với khuynh hướng giữ các giá trị truyền thống trong xã hội bằng cách tránh những thay đổi
